title: Web Development
subtitle: The art of building websites and web applications
content:
## Overview

**Web development** is the work involved in developing a website for the Internet or an intranet. Web development can range from developing a simple single static page of plain text to complex web applications, electronic businesses, and social network services.

Web development typically refers to the non-design aspects of building websites: writing markup and coding. It includes client-side coding, server-side coding, and database technology.

## Frontend Development

Frontend development focuses on what users see and interact with in their browser. Key technologies include:

- **HTML** — The structure of web pages
- **CSS** — The styling and layout of web pages
- **[[JavaScript]]** — The behavior and interactivity of web pages
- **[[React]]** — A popular library for building user interfaces
- **[[TypeScript]]** — A typed superset of JavaScript for larger projects

## Backend Development

Backend development handles the server-side logic, databases, and APIs that power web applications:

- **[[Node.js]]** — JavaScript runtime for server-side programming
- **[[Express]]** — Web framework for building APIs and web servers
- **[[REST API]]** — Architectural style for designing web services
- **Databases** — Storage systems like PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL

## Full-Stack Development

Full-stack developers work with both frontend and backend technologies. A common modern stack includes:

- **Frontend**: [[React]] with [[TypeScript]]
- **Backend**: [[Node.js]] with [[Express]]
- **Database**: PostgreSQL or MongoDB
- **API**: [[REST API]] or GraphQL

## Modern Web Development Practices

### Version Control
Git is the standard version control system used by nearly all web developers. GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket provide hosting for Git repositories.

### Package Management
npm (Node Package Manager) is the largest software registry in the world, with over 1.3 million packages available for [[JavaScript]] and [[Node.js]] projects.

### Responsive Design
Modern websites must work across devices of all sizes. CSS media queries, flexible grids, and frameworks help create responsive layouts.

### Performance Optimization
Web performance is critical for user experience. Techniques include code splitting, lazy loading, caching, and image optimization.
